title: Can someone use the same essay for more than one college application? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. That is what I did when applying to UF and FSU (hopefully they don’t see this). Just make sure you change the school name if you included it in your essay anywhere. Imagine how embarrassing that would be if I later realized I forgot to change “and that’s why I want to go to Florida State” when I sent the essay to UF. Immediate rejection. However I do not recommend taking such an easy way out, especially if you are applying to more competitive colleges. I believe they want to see something more specialized to them. I could get away with it though because in reality I made my essay to FSU specifically. I used the same one with some easier schools that I knew for sure I would get in, and didn’t really care about UF. FSU>UF

If you are using the Common Application, the schools you apply to with it will see your personal essay unless you make a concerted effort to write an essay, submit your application to College A, edit your Common Application, delete essay one and write essay two for College B. If a school has supplemental questions it wants you to answer, then only the school asking these questions will see your response.
